experimenter.description: Name of person/people who performed experiment

identifier.description: A unique text identifier for the file. If one is not provided it will be randomly assigned

session_description.description: A description of the session where this data was generated

session_start_time.description: The start date and time of the recording session

surgery.description: Narrative description about surgery/surgeries, including date(s) and who performed surgery.

pharmacology.description: Description of drugs used, including how and when they were administered. Anesthesia(s), painkiller(s), etc., plus dosage, concentration, etc.

protocol.description: Experimental protocol, if applicable. E.g., include IACUC protocol

slices.description: Description of slices, including information about preparation thickness, orientation, temperature and bath solution.

source_script.description: Script file used to create this NWB file.

source_script_file_name.description: Script file used to create this NWB file.

virus.description: Information about virus(es) used in experiments, including virus ID, source, date made, injection location, volume, etc.

data_collection.description: Notes about data collection and analysis.

stimulus_notes.description: Notes about stimuli, such as how and where presented.

age.description: The age of the subject. The ISO 8601 Duration format is recommended, e.g., 'P90D' for 90 days old, 'P2W' for 2 weeks old, 'P18Y' for 18 years old.

age__reference.description: Age is with reference to this event. Can be 'birth' or 'gestational'.

description.description: Description of subject and where subject came from (e.g., breeder, if animal).

genotype.description: Genetic strain. If absent, assume Wild Type (WT)

species.description: Species of subject. Use latin name.

subject_id.description: ID of animal/person used/participating in experiment (lab convention)

weight.description: Weight at time of experiment, at time of surgery and at other important times.

date_of_birth.description: Date of birth of subject. Can be supplied instead of 'age'.

strain.description: The strain of the subject, e.g., 'C57BL/6J'
